channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2023080130
item.description:
Report E-2023080130

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LLA experienced a UN3108 Varox DBPH-50 release from (2) 45-pound boxes. ERTS dispatched contractors to complete cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-pound of product released impacting a 3' x 3' area of the trailer floor due to being crushed as a result of improper loading. The released product and damaged boxes were containerized into (2) 55-gallon vented poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023080478
item.description:
Report X-2023080478

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: EDINBURG
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was inbound scan at 0412 on 7/25/2023 at Edin 0785 and placed under the rollers at unload door 6 since it was a misloaded package. At 0700 QA was working on packages in the unload and came across the Item. Outer packaging looked wet damaged, so contents were inspected. Upon inspection it was found that 1 of the inner items had a leak. Package was placed in a yellow salvage drum and secured at QA1 to be processed post sort. DescribePack: Outer package appears wet damaged at the bottom one third / base of the package at one side. Tape closing/securing the bottom of the package is only covering 1/4 of the closure. only 1 of the 4 inner containers appears to be undamaged. 2 items appear dented at their base but have no leak. One inner container is crushed/dented at its base and has leaked over 1/2 of its contents. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA found the package inspection was performed to identify the cause of the wet damage on the outer packaging. When it was found to be caused by the inner contents of the package, item was secured and placed in a yellow salvaged drum and taken to QA1.

item.title: Report E-2023080024
item.description:
Report E-2023080024

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 25, 2023, at 1600 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (1) gallon of Zip-Slip 154S Release Agent (UN1993, 3, II) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was reportedly due to a forklift puncture, and it was contained to a 5’x5’ area on the trailer floor. The release was cleaned up with the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release (which was the punctured drum) was containerized in (1) 85-gallon poly metal drum and will be returned to the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2023080212
item.description:
Report X-2023080212

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: MESQUITE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080212 SequenceEvent: Package was removed from the IC conveyor belt onto the IC rollers in preparation for loading. The rollers did not have a stop/catch at the end so the bucket rolled off onto the floor and the lid popped loose, causing it to spill. The bucket was returned to an upright position and QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were laid down to prevent to any injuries. DescribePack: The bucket was dropped onto its side and the lid popped open. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bucket was returned to an upright position and QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were laid down to prevent to any injuries. 2. X-2023080214 SequenceEvent: Package was removed from the IC conveyor belt onto the IC rollers in preparation for loading. The IC rollers did not have a stop/catch at the end and so the package rolled off onto the floor which popped the lid loose and caused it to leak. The bucket was turned back to an upright position to prevent further leaking and QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and brought back to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The package dropped from the IC rollers onto the floor which caused the lid to come loose and start leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bucket was turned back to an upright position to prevent further leaking and QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and brought back to the hazmat cage.

item.description:
